title: TE Norton pledges to Penn
text:
TE Norton pledges to Penn EDGYTIM Talk about it in the edgytim Message Boards 
Lincolnshire (Ill.) Stevenson senior tight end recruit Matt Norton (6-foot-6, 235 pounds) ended his recruiting process and gave Penn his verbal commitment. Norton talks about his decision and much more here. 
"I decided to give Penn my verbal commitment," Norton said. "I made a recent unofficial visit and I just loved it at Penn. Overall Penn is just a great fit for me so I committed." 
Norton talked about why he decided to pledge to the Penn Quakers. 
"I just loved it at Penn on my visit. It's more of an urban campus in Philadelphia and it's exactly what I was looking for in a school. I was able to get to know the coaches and the players and everyone was great. I'm planning to to major in business and Penn offers a world class education and an amazing business program. I narrowed it down to Penn or Princeton and in the end it was just the feeling I had at Penn that sealed it for me." 
Norton is thrilled to have his recruiting process behind him. 
"I couldn't be happier that it's all over. We've been playing much better football the past few weeks (after the loss to Libertyville) and I can just focus on the rest of the season without worrying about recruiting." 
Matt Norton is verbally committed to Penn.
